snippet: Several of the century-old wood-plank promenades integral to the identity of coastal communities in New Jersey and New York were destroyed by Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Several century-old wood-plank boardwalks in New York and New Jersey are severely ravaged or destroyed by Hurricane Sandy; damage is mourned by local residents, for whom boardwalks symbolized not just summer fun but way of life that sustained businesses and tied together communities.

byline.original: By WENDY RUDERMAN and KATE ZERNIKE

lead_paragraph: Several of the century-old wood-plank promenades integral to the identity of coastal communities in New Jersey and New York were destroyed by Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: In Boardwalk Towns, a Way of Life Lies in Splinters
headline.main: Where Boardwalks Beckoned, a Way of Life Lies in Splinters
headline.print_headline: Where Boardwalks Beckoned, A Way of Life Lies in Splinters
